185696615.review:
Fantastic horror game that breaks the usual mold of "you can try and run and hide or avoid to save resources."
Combines action and horror seamlessly. No longer can you cower and hope the creatures avoid you, the screaming, hissing, gurgling necromorphs are instantly in your face and slicing at you. Suspenseful scenes done well and scary atmospheres aplenty. The only thing to mention is that disabling v-sync drastically changes the experience and must be done. 
A must play for any horror fans.

185425351.review:
This game is life changing, don't call yourself an action-horror enjoyer if you've never played this game. First time I touched this game was 2024 halloween on my med-low-end laptop. After I played the remake of Dead Space 1 on Xbox I enjoyed it but didn't play much of it, I saw this go on a deal and I thought I'd try it out since it was only $5.99 Bought it not expecting much thinking I'd play the intro and leave like every other game but I started playing while listening to music and it was like a whole other experience, this mix of knowing you're going to die but that you have the power to save yourself this game is truly one of a kind that we will never experience in the rest of gaming history. I had to force myself to take a break because I was playing this game for a couple days straight which eventually lead to me losing all interest but that's common for me as I don't have a high attention span. 

If you're looking for Horror and you enjoy action, this could be the game but this game is like every other Dead Space and is based more on Quick Reaction than anything. The cutscene gameplay make this game true peak, and the general pace of the game going from going on an elevator fighting off giant necromorphs to flying around in space make this game feel like an interactive movie.

11/10 Game would suggest, no other Action-Horror will ever compare.

185356790.review:
Dead Space 2 is a masterpiece of a game.

It excels at everything ranging from story telling and characters, gameplay, level design and pacing, graphics and sound design. 

Dead Space 2 has had a significant impact on me personally - even outside of gaming - to an extent that I can say that I would not be in my life where I am today, hadn't I played this game 13 years ago for the first time. 
And thus, it is and will always be the most important game I've ever put my hands on.

I just hope EA will never touch this game and try to remake it. As there is a high chance that they will fail to improve upon what Visceral Games built over a decade ago.

185161675.review:
Dead Space 2 is an exceptional sequel that not only builds upon the strengths of its predecessor but also refines and expands them to create a masterclass in survival horror. 
This game delivers a perfect blend of heart-pounding action, psychological terror, and emotional depth, cementing its place as one of the finest entries in the genre!
Once again, players step into the shoes of Isaac Clarke, now a more vocal and fully fleshed-out protagonist. 
The game wastes no time thrusting you into chaos, opening with one of the most intense and memorable sequences in gaming history. 
From that moment on, Dead Space 2 never lets up, keeping you on edge with its relentless pacing and expertly crafted scares.
The gameplay is tighter and more polished than ever! 
Combat retains the strategic dismemberment mechanic that made the first game so unique, but the improved weapon variety and smoother controls make every encounter feel fresh and exhilarating. 
The zero-gravity sections are vastly improved, offering more freedom of movement and adding an exciting new dimension to exploration and combat.
The Sprawl is a terrifyingly immersive setting, with its diverse environments ranging from eerie residential quarters to hauntingly quiet schools and churches. 
The sound design remains a standout feature, with every creak, whisper, and Necromorph screech contributing to an almost unbearable tension. 
The game’s visuals are stunning, showcasing intricate details and gruesome effects that bring the horrors of the Sprawl to life...
Isaac’s struggle with his traumatic past and deteriorating mental state is deeply compelling, adding a psychological layer to the horror. 
The game’s narrative expertly balances action-packed moments with quieter, introspective scenes that give Isaac’s journey real heart. 
The addition of Ellie Langford as a strong and likable ally further enriches the story, providing a glimmer of hope amidst the darkness...
Dead Space 2 also excels in its variety of gameplay moments. 
From intense boss battles and adrenaline-pumping set pieces to quieter, puzzle-solving sections, the game keeps you engaged and constantly guessing what’s next! 
In every way, Dead Space 2 is a worthy successor to the original. 
It’s a thrilling, terrifying, and emotionally resonant journey that improves on its predecessor while carving its own identity. 
Whether you’re a fan of the first game or new to the series, Dead Space 2 is an unmissable experience that deserves a spot in every horror fan’s library!

184958171.review:
Dead Space 2 is revered as one of the kings in its genre and playing it in 2024/early 2025, I can confidently  say it holds up pretty well.

If you are coming from Dead Space Remake, it's important to align your expectations. This game came from a time where things were technically much simpler, games were more straightforward, there were scripted things everywhere. The graphics have aged quite a lot (yet, with modern hardware, you can easily play it in 4k and at a high refresh rate which makes things much smoother), the sound quality is muddy, audio logs are hard to actually understand, some of the voiceovers lean more towards low quality than AAA, and the exploration aspect is almost non-existant. 

That being said, the game is undeniably great. The atmosphere is all there, and whilst the shift to "more open areas" had me a bit insecure before playing it on launch, it was masterfully done to a point I can't tell whether the claustrophobic halls of the Ishimura on the original are scarier than the far wider and properly lit areas of Titan Station. The audio design sets up the mood just as well as the remake did last year, only what? 12 years before that? The combat is pretty much the same with a few interesting additions to both your arsenal and the horrifying disgrace of nightmare fuel you are going to tear apart. The story holds up extremely well, both a decade later and as a sequel to a lore-packed story - which I may add is one of my favorite sci-fi stories of all time.

So if you haven't yet, buy this game. It's dirt cheap for what you get. I hope one day we actually get a proper ending to the IP (or a remake of this one and have EA call it a day).

184846296.review:
Dead Space 2 é um dos maiores exemplos de como uma sequência pode melhorar e expandir o que foi apresentado no jogo original. Lançado em 2011, a sequência da famosa franquia de terror espacial da Visceral Games é um marco no gênero de survival horror, refinando a fórmula com uma narrativa mais imersiva, mecânicas mais complexas e uma atmosfera ainda mais assustadora. Nesta análise, vamos explorar os principais pontos que definem a qualidade do jogo, como o enredo, gameplay, e a direção artística.

1. Enredo e Personagens
Em Dead Space 2, os jogadores retomam o controle de Isaac Clarke, o engenheiro sobrevivente do primeiro jogo, agora em uma estação espacial chamada Sprawl. O enredo apresenta um Isaac ainda traumatizado pelos eventos do primeiro jogo, enfrentando alucinações e uma luta interna com a perda de sua amada Nicole. Ao mesmo tempo, ele precisa lidar com a ameaça dos Necromorphs, criaturas reanimadas de corpos humanos mortos, que estão infestando a estação.

O jogo se destaca pela construção do personagem de Isaac. Enquanto no primeiro Dead Space ele era mais um protagonista silencioso e genérico, em Dead Space 2 ele se torna um personagem muito mais complexo, com uma voz própria e uma história de fundo mais desenvolvida. Sua luta contra seus próprios demônios e a crescente tensão psicológica são aspectos fundamentais da narrativa. Além disso, a interação com outros personagens, como o misterioso Hammond e a enigmática Daina, enriquece o enredo, mantendo o jogador sempre investido na história.

2. Mecânicas de Jogo e Gameplay
A jogabilidade de Dead Space 2 mantém a essência do jogo original, mas com várias melhorias. O jogo continua focado na exploração, resolução de quebra-cabeças e combate estratégico contra os Necromorphs. A principal inovação aqui é a maior variedade de armas e a implementação de mais táticas de combate. O sistema de desmembramento, que foi a principal característica de combate do primeiro jogo, permanece, mas com mais opções e uma maior diversidade de Necromorphs, tornando os confrontos ainda mais desafiadores e imprevisíveis.

Além disso, o jogo tem uma movimentação mais fluida, com Isaac podendo se movimentar em ambientes de zero gravidade de maneira mais intuitiva. Isso adiciona uma camada extra de tensão, pois, em ambientes de gravidade zero, os Necromorphs podem atacar de qualquer direção, o que exige uma leitura constante do cenário e posicionamento estratégico.

Um ponto negativo, no entanto, é que Dead Space 2 possui mais momentos de ação frenética em comparação ao seu antecessor. Embora isso ajude a manter o ritmo do jogo, alguns fãs do primeiro título acharam que essas partes mais "ação" poderiam desvirtuar um pouco a essência de terror psicológico.

3. Atmosfera e Direção Artística
Um dos maiores triunfos de Dead Space 2 é a sua atmosfera, que combina elementos de terror psicológico e survival horror com uma sensação constante de claustrofobia e desespero. A estação Sprawl, com seus corredores apertados e ambientes mal iluminados, é um cenário perfeito para o jogo, e o design dos ambientes é excepcional. A direção artística se destaca pela sua habilidade de criar ambientes com um visual único e ao mesmo tempo repulsivo, tornando cada novo local que você explora ainda mais ameaçador.

A trilha sonora e os efeitos sonoros são também cruciais para intensificar o clima de tensão. O som é perfeitamente orquestrado para criar uma sensação de opressão, com os rangidos das paredes e o barulho das criaturas se aproximando aumentando o desconforto do jogador. A ausência de música constante, combinada com os gritos e os sons grotescos dos Necromorphs, faz com que cada encontro seja tenso e assustador.

4. Gráficos e Performance
Considerando que Dead Space 2 foi lançado em 2011, ele se mantém visualmente impressionante até hoje. O design dos Necromorphs é grotesco e detalhado, e os ambientes estão incrivelmente bem trabalhados. A iluminação dinâmica também é usada de maneira inteligente para criar atmosferas de suspense, escondendo ou revelando detalhes que aumentam a tensão. Em termos de performance, o jogo se mantém estável em diversas plataformas, oferecendo uma experiência suave.

5. Desafios e Dificuldade
Dead Space 2 não é um jogo fácil. Embora o título tenha algumas opções de dificuldade, ele sempre exige que o jogador faça bom uso de seus recursos limitados, como munição e medkits. Em muitas partes do jogo, você precisará decidir se vale a pena enfrentar os Necromorphs ou evitar o confronto, o que adiciona uma camada de estratégia à jogabilidade. A inteligência artificial dos inimigos também contribui para o desafio, já que os Necromorphs são imprevisíveis e atacam em grupos, tornando a sobrevivência uma tarefa difícil.

6. Conclusão
Dead Space 2 é uma sequência brilhante que mantém a essência do original enquanto expande suas mecânicas e enredo de maneira eficaz. Com um Isaac mais desenvolvido, uma história envolvente, e uma atmosfera aterrorizante, o jogo é um dos melhores exemplos de survival horror da sua geração. Apesar de uma ênfase maior na ação em algumas partes, ele ainda consegue manter uma tensão constante e uma experiência de terror psicológico imersiva. É, sem dúvida, uma obra-prima dentro do gênero, e um dos melhores jogos de terror espacial de todos os tempos.

184731151.review:
This is what happens when developers are firing on all cylinders and strive to create something that surpasses the original game. Dead Space 2 is bigger, better and more intense than the first one where just about everything has been improved on. Combat is more diverse and fast paced (more weapons, more enemy variety, better controls) while never losing focus on the main ingredient here: the horror.
The game's story never slows down from the second you boot it up and constantly finds new ways to get you on the edge of your seat while also peppering in just enough lore for the loreheads to dive into.

This is how you do a sequel and is honestly one of the best examples of how much better triple A games used to be a couple generations ago, and reminded me of how nice is was to be excited for a game, finally getting your hands on it and then having it deliver everything you expected and more. An absolute must play for survival horror fans.

184476907.review:
Dead Space 2 jest świetną, ale też bardzo bezpieczną kontynuacją równie dobrej pierwszej części. Po zastanowieniu się, skategoryzowałbym nawet DS2 jako taki bardzo duży dodatek do pierwszej części. Mamy kilka nowych broni, kilka nowych przeciwników, zupełnie nowe lokacje w których osadzona jest kontynuacja fabuły z jedynki... i to tyle. Gameplay pozostał się dosłownie identyczny, ale ulepszony pod paroma względami, tak żeby się fajniej grało. Najbardziej zauważalne jest zwiększenie płynności poruszania się oraz ataków wręcz (wydaje mi się też że zwiększono ich obrażenia), a także wprowadzenie mechaniki wypadania ammo z przeciwników dopiero po tym jak ich zdeptamy. Osoba, która na to wpadła musiała być geniuszem, bo to dosłownie idealnie pasuje do tej gry, szczególnie że możemy też zdeptać konkretną kończynę leżącego wroga o niskim HP, żeby ją odseparować od reszty ciała, co go szybko wykończy (mamy tu praktycznie wszystkich nekromorfów z jedynki i urywanie im kończyn nadal zadaje dodatkowe obrażenia). W jedynce często tak czy siak deptałem wrogów bo fajnie to wyglądało i było satysfakcjonujące, więc tutaj dokopywanie powalonym oponentom przyszło mi naturalnie. DS2 wprowadziło jeszcze jedną, znaczącą nowość, aczkolwiek obecną tylko w niektórych obszarach - jest nią nowy movement w zero-gravity, a konkretnie możliwość latania. Jest ona zrobiona dosyć dobrze i sprawia, że sekwencje bez grawitacji są jeszcze fajniejsze, a także wyglądają bardziej widowiskowo. 

Cały gameplay w tej części jest ogólnie szybszy, nie tylko my mamy większą swobodę ruchów, ale także wiele przeciwników może doskoczyć/dobiec do nas niezwykle szybko. W porównaniu z dość dużą ilością wrogów tworzy to czasami bardzo chaotyczne walki w których musimy dosłownie walczyć o nasze życie (i na wyższych poziomach trudności odpowiednio zarządzać zasobami, szczególnie że ich brak oznacza śmierć). Nie tylko jednak gameplay, a cała gra stawia mocniej na akcję - mamy tutaj znacznie więcej over-the-top cutscenek w których nasz bohater np. spada z orbity do budynku położonego kilka kilometrów poniżej, same tempo opowieści też jest znacznie szybsze - już po kilku sekundach od rozpoczęcia nowej gry musimy walczyć o nasze życie. Horror jednak nadal tutaj występuje i choć przyznam, że ogólnie jest go trochę mniej niż w jedynce, to dwójka nie jest go pozbawiona - parę razy gra mnie rzeczywiście przestraszyła, a w wielu obszarach czułem niepokój.

Gra ma jednak jedną rzecz do której bym się przyczepił, a mianowice brak walk z bossami. Wszelcy wyjątkowi przeciwnicy jakich spotykamy są jedynie minibossami, których kopie będziemy spotykać raz na jakiś czas, albo cała walka z nimi ograniczy się do cutscenki, z którą nie będziemy mieli żadnej interakcji. Przez cała grę mamy tylko jedno pełnoprawnego bossa i to pod sam koniec. Choć muszę przyznać, że ten jeden boss jest na prawdę świetny, to nadal brak jakichkolwiek innych starć przez resztę gry trochę mnie zawiódł. Nie jest to jednak poważna wada, patrząc na to jak rozległy jest w tej grze bestiariusz, a także różne opcje radzenia z nim sobie. Oprócz tego, przyczepiłbym się do wszelkich problemów natury technicznej, a konkretnie tego że EA ma wy*ebane na wszystkie swoje stare tytuły i gra ma trochę problemów, które mogłyby być łatwo naprawione gdyby poświęcono im chwilę uwagi.

Dead Space 2 polecam każdemu komu spodobała się pierwsza część. Zalecam koniecznie przejść najpierw jedynkę (albo remake), gdyż fabuła jest bezpośrednią kontynuacją i parę rzeczy może nie mieć sensu bez znajomości wydarzeń z poprzedniej gry. Jeśli ktoś jednak bardzo chce zacząć do tej części, to w głównym menu jest możliwość wyświetlenia filmu podsumowującego DS1. DS2 może i nie wprowadza za dużo nowości, ale solidne podstawy z jedynki, świetnie poprowadzona fabuła i udoskonalenie gameplayu prawie do perfekcji czynią ten tytuł niezwykle wciągającym i przyjemnym do grania. 

Grę ukończyłem w podobnym czasie co część pierwszą (kilkanaście godzin) (może troszkę dłuższym) na poziomie trudności Zealot. Na pierwsze przejście jednak go raczej nie polecam, gra na nim bywa miejscami frustrująca przez ataki które nas 1 shottują, albo zabierają 80% naszego maksymalnego zdrowia. Na początku gra wydaje się zbyt prosta, ale potem poziom trudności skacze na prawdę wysoko. Osobom zaczynającym przygodę z DS2 zalecam poziom Survivalist, który powinien mieć znacznie bardziej zrównoważone wartości obrażeń i który zgodnie zresztą z opisem jest zalecany osobom, które skończyły poprzednią część.

+ Bardzo dobra, bardziej rozbudowana niż w poprzedniej części fabuła

+ Protagonista nie jest niemy jak w jedynce, a wątek jego radzenia sobie z traumą po wydarzeniach z poprzedniej gry jest bardzo interesujący

+ Kilka nowych broni, a także powrót całego uzbrojenia z jedynki (co daje łącznie około 11 typów broni, każda z alternatywnym trybem strzelania)

+ Bardzo duża różnorodność wrogów - powracają praktycznie wszyscy oponenci z poprzedniej gry, a także jest dodanych kilka nowych, bardzo ciekawych przeciwników. Szczególnie spodobał mi się stalker, który chowa się za przeszkodami i przygląda się nam dobrą chwilę zanim zacznie na nas szarżować

+ Sporo zupełnie nowych lokacji, które są znacznie bardziej różnorodne niż to co widzieliśmy w jedynce (tutaj mamy m.in. sektory mieszkalne ze sklepami, kościół sekty czy nawet szkołę) 

+ Różne rodzaje kombinezonów zapewniające pasywne efekty jak większe obrażenia daną bronią

+ Sekwencje w obszarach bez grawitacji dostały jedną zasadnicza zmianę - zamiast chodzić po ścianach i po skakać z jednej powierzchni na drugą, mamy nielimitowany lot. Wprowadza to trochę świeżości, a w niektórych miejscach (w kosmosie) możemy dzięki temu ujrzeć bardzo ładne widoczki 

+ Wszelkie ruchy są płynniejsze niż w jedynce i ogólnie gra się jeszcze lepiej

+ Bardzo satysfakcjonujące kopanie wrogów w celu pozyskania z nich zapasów

+ Dobrze wyglądające masakrowanie ciał oraz kilka na prawdę mocnych scen

+ Trochę lepsza niż w jedynce grafika, zauważyłem trochę lepsze tekstury oraz oświetlenie. W porównaniu do jedynki, tutaj mamy też znacznie więcej cutscenek, które w dodatku mają na prawdę świetną animację

+ Podobnie dobry co w jedynce design dźwięku informujący o obecności wrogów, ale też dosyć dobra muzyka

+- Jedynka nie była żadną metroidvanią, ale pozwalała na pewną, niewielką eksplorację obszarów, tutaj natomiast wszystko jest jeszcze bardziej liniowe i praktycznie cała gra nie licząc jednego czy dwóch poziomów (np. kościół unitologów) zakłada przemierzenie jednej ścieżki bez udawania się w poszukiwaniu zasobów do pobocznych odnóg poziomów

- Gra nie ma żadnych boss fight'ów nie licząc ostatniego (który jest akurat bardzo dobry)

- Ten sam problem z ograniczeniem fps-ów do 30, co w DS1 (rozwiązanie tego problemu jest te same, wystarczy wyłączyć V-sync w opcjach gry, wyłączyć grę i włączyć synchronizację pionową dla DeadSpace2.exe w Nvidia control panel lub odpowiedniku AMD)

- Wszystkie DLC dające darmowe przedmioty "premium" są domyślnie włączone do gry i będą nam zaśmiecać sklep z przedmiotami od początku aż do końca. Oprócz tego EA wyłączyło serwery gry, co sprawia że nie da się nawet wejść w zakładkę multiplayer. Sprawia to jednak też pojawianie się komunikatu o błędzie połączenia z serwerem przy każdym uruchomieniu gry na który czasami trzeba z niewiadomych powodów dłużej poczekać zanim się pojawi i będzie go można zamknąć

- Brak DLC Dead Space 2: Severed w PC-towej wersji gry

184282916.review:
7/10

Dead Space 2 is easily worth the 5 USD I paid for it. However, I've been greatly spoiled by the Dead Space 1 Remake, and this was a significant step down in style and quality.

This game captured a lot of the same feel from the first game and you absolutely need to play it if you liked the first one. The voice actor for the MC was great and I can see why they brought him back to reprise his role for the DS1 Remake. The main [spoiler] female lead [/spoiler] was super likable. It has a great horror "feel" and captures a lot of fear elements that make a great survival horror game (e.g., Resident Evil 2). 

However, the game suffers from the same problems as Resident Evil 6 & 8, emphasizing too much fast-paced game-play. The enemy encounters happen at breakneck speed compared to the first game and robs you of the true value of the genre. Jump scares are great, but when you're dead before you know it because of some enemy jumping out of the dark and taking half your health before being finished off by five enemies surrounding you, you just get irritated and the thrill is gone. I never felt like I got a chance to take a look at the enemies I was fighting and really appreciate the mechanics and design of each one. There was a strategy for beating each enemy in DS1 but DS2 just feels like a very long version of the shooting gallery mini-game/side quest from DS1. Too much call of duty energy for a game that should be a slow burn. The mental pressure put on a player from the regenerating Necromorphs in DS1 was executed to near perfection like Mr. X from Resident Evil 2. The regenerator enemy in this game [spoiler] doesn't show up until the very last chapter and just feels like an ammo/ability sink because of the army of enemies dog-piling you faster than you can move or react [/spoiler]. 

Other negatives: 
- The controller support was not good and I was forced to play with janky keyboard & mouse controls instead. 
- An antiquated equipment upgrade system that you won't use because it's not worth the time since you really just need to buy lots of ammo on higher difficulties. To beat the final boss on the middle difficulty, you'll need at least 350 rounds for a fully upgraded pulse rifle. If you make it there with less, I hope you have a manual save at the buy station, lol. 
- The pointless quick time events that were mindlessly shoved into every game from the 2007-2013 era are a huge pain.
- I had to do the 10+ processor core fix
- if you die before completing the trip to the solar array station, there's a glitch that forces you to load from the manual save point, losing at least 15-30 minutes of time if you only die twice in the section. 

Overall, I liked the game for the story since I already played DS1 and there were some moments that recaptured the same feel of the first game. However, the age of the game shows, and the remake of DS1 is the far superior gaming experience for the genre. I'm super disappointed they probably aren't going to remake DS2 because of under-performing sales numbers (only 2 million copies). Slowing down the pace of the game-play and re-balancing the game mechanics to more effectively scale difficulty would make this game a 10/10 experience.

184254838.review:
I only have 2 main complaints that bothered me a wee bit:
The first one would be the "weapon wheel". It's pure shite. You have to memorise what key brings you to what gun, which is doable, but it's really frustrating to deal with in a intensive combat situation.
The second one is how many enemies are thrown at you. I don't remember the first game being like that. (there's been a while since I've played it, but still) Sometimes, you have to face hordes of enemies, coming fae everywhere. And they being bullet sponges at the end of the game just doesnae help at all.

But, aside fae that, I loved it: the atmosphere, the weapon designs and everything, in general. A classic and a must-play

184101910.review:
I'd love to say that Dead Space 2 was a masterpiece like Dead Space 1, but I'd lie.
Dead Space 2 was a good game, but still had things that I disliked a lot.

+ Much better jump scares than Dead Space 1
+ More intense ending compared with Dead Space 1
- Too many useless weapons (made weapon system trash)
- Too many useless suits (made suit system trash)
- No break between chapters. If you dont look on bottom right corner all the  time you can miss the transition between chapters.
- most of times you dont have a save station before ending a chapter, so you have to advance a bit into the new chapter to save.

If i'll have to ignore all those negative things and focus only on gameplay, the game was not bad at all.
The game was very good, but still far far away from the greatness of the Dead Space 1...

183799229.review:
Dead Space 2 — одна з найкращих ігор у жанрі survival horror, випущена у 2011 році студією Visceral Games. Гра отримала схвальні відгуки за вдосконалений ігровий процес, глибокий сюжет і захоплюючу атмосферу.
1.Атмосфера і сюжет  
Айзек Кларк повертається як головний герой, тепер зі складним внутрішнім конфліктом і голосом, що робить персонажа ще глибшим. Історія добре продумана, а моменти психологічного жаху додають грі емоційної напруги. Космічна станція «Спроул» — це чудово пророблена локація, що створює ідеальний фон для гри.
2.Графіка та звуковий дизайн  
Гра виглядає чудово навіть сьогодні. Освітлення, деталізація монстрів (некроморфів) і спецефекти вражають. Аудіо-дизайн підсилює відчуття страху — звуки у коридорах постійно тримають у напрузі.
3.Геймплей 
Покращене управління, нові види зброї та різноманітні вороги роблять гру більш динамічною. Поява безгравітаційних зон і нові механіки переміщення додають різноманіття. Крім того, гра зберігає баланс між екшеном і хорором.
Висновок:
Dead Space 2 — це вдала еволюція серії. Гра вражає якістю виконання і стане чудовим вибором для шанувальників хорорів і наукової фантастики. Якщо вас цікавлять ігри з напруженою атмосферою та динамічним ігровим процесом, Dead Space 2 — це те, що варто спробувати.

183538537.review: 一代的升级版，忠实地延续了前作的风格，并在其基础上加以创新，比前作成熟很多。恐怖氛围不输一代，且场景更加多样，怪物种类更加丰富（小孩哥和婴儿怪放到今天的游戏怕不是会被白左冲烂），一代的一些垃圾武器也得到了加强，二代在恐怖生存和战斗中找到了平衡，艾萨克的形象也比前作饱满许多，虽然还是很工具人。不过一些问题也是系列通病了，怪物种类多了，但应对方法并没有什么改变，很是单调。营造的恐怖气氛通篇都是同样地套路来回使用，导致到中期后就没什么恐怖感了，而且整个游戏流程居然没有个像样BOSS让我倾销一下攒下来的子弹和药物，多少有点不得劲。

183516781.review:
To me this was more enjoyable than Dead Space 1 in every way. The horror never hit for me anyways so the move to action was simply an improvement. Gameplay has also been refined and feels leagues better while keeping the same tension DS1 pulled off so well.

Important to note though is that the otherwise buttery smooth gameplay is limited to 30 fps if the in-game vsync option is enabled, so make sure to turn that off and activate it in your graphics control panel instead.

Please give this one a chance, it doesn't even [i]need[/i] a remake!
